affiliation: Assistant Professor of Instructional Technology, University of Tennessee
name: Jay Pfaffman
biography: Jay Pfaffman (Peabody College of Vanderbilt University, 2003) teaches courses in instructional technology research and using computers to support learning. He uses Free Open Source Software (FOSS) not only to provide teachers with the software but also to use Linux Terminal Servers and diskless thin clients to provide affordable ubiquitous computing to schools. He has developed web-based tools to support teaching and learning including Webliographer, a social bookmarking tool designed specifically for teachers.
